intro: Schmidelia nitidula, commonly known as the smoothleaf schmidelia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Schmidelia nitidula is often found in rich, loamy soils and is an important component of understory vegetation in eastern deciduous forests.
